properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis-firehose.access-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Access Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis-firehose.amazon-kinesis-firehose-client
properties.description: Amazon Kinesis Firehose client to use for all requests for this endpoint. The option is a com.amazonaws.services.kinesisfirehose.AmazonKinesisFirehose type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis-firehose.auto-discover-client
properties.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis-firehose.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis-firehose.configuration
properties.description: The component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.aws.firehose.KinesisFirehoseConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis-firehose.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the aws-kinesis-firehose component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis-firehose.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis-firehose.proxy-host
properties.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the Kinesis Firehose client

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis-firehose.proxy-port
properties.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the Kinesis Firehose client

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis-firehose.proxy-protocol
properties.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the Kinesis Firehose client

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis-firehose.region
properties.description: The region in which Kinesis client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the capitalized name of the region (for example AP_EAST_1)You'll need to use the name Regions.EU_WEST_1.name()

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis-firehose.secret-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Secret Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.access-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Access Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.amazon-kinesis-client
properties.description: Amazon Kinesis client to use for all requests for this endpoint. The option is a com.amazonaws.services.kinesis.AmazonKinesis type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.auto-discover-client
properties.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.configuration
properties.description: The component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.aws.kinesis.KinesisConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the aws-kinesis component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.iterator-type
properties.description: Defines where in the Kinesis stream to start getting records

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.max-results-per-request
properties.description: Maximum number of records that will be fetched in each poll

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.proxy-host
properties.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the Kinesis client

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.proxy-port
properties.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the Kinesis client

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.proxy-protocol
properties.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the Kinesis client

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.region
properties.description: The region in which Kinesis client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the capitalized name of the region (for example AP_EAST_1)You'll need to use the name Regions.EU_WEST_1.name()

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.secret-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Secret Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.sequence-number
properties.description: The sequence number to start polling from. Required if iteratorType is set to AFTER_SEQUENCE_NUMBER or AT_SEQUENCE_NUMBER

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.shard-closed
properties.description: Define what will be the behavior in case of shard closed. Possible value are ignore, silent and fail. In case of ignore a message will be logged and the consumer will restart from the beginning,in case of silent there will be no logging and the consumer will start from the beginning,in case of fail a ReachedClosedStateException will be raised

properties.name: camel.component.aws-kinesis.shard-id
properties.description: Defines which shardId in the Kinesis stream to get records from
